Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, children, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, through its completion, its end has been reached, and through its expositions and declarations, it is clear to me that I have completed it for you with this treatise, which is a part of the manual operation, that is, surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because the manual operation is widespread in our region and time, it is almost entirely private, to the extent that the knowledge of it is greatly endangered, and its practice is obstructed; and only a few small descriptions remain in the books of the Ancients, which have been misinterpreted and have caused error and hesitation, to the point that understanding of it has been lost and the skill has diminished.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I can revive it [the manual operation] through the organization of this treatise, following the method of exposition, declaration, and abbreviation; and so that it may come with the forms of cautery instruments and other tools of the craft, as it is by adding to the explanation, and by preparing them, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the reason why a skilled artisan with a practiced hand is not found in this time of ours is that the art of medicine is extensive, and that its practitioner must previously be versed in the science of anatomy, which encompasses the knowledge of the body's organs and their forms, and their connections and separations; and must know the bones, nerves and muscles, their numbers, and their distribution; and the pulsating and still veins, and the locations from which they emerge.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And therefore Hippocrates said that with one name is meant much, but in the practice it is small, and more so in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	But we have already mentioned this in the introduction to this book; for whoever is not knowledgeable in what we have stated about anatomy cannot avoid falling into errors that will lead to the deaths of people, just as I have seen many such cases.  Some are trained in this science, yet depart from it without knowledge or experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a foolish and inexperienced physician open an scrofulous abscess on a woman's neck, and cut some of the arteries in her neck, so that a great deal of blood flowed until the woman died in his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another physician who thought he should remove a stone from a man who was old, and the stone was large.  He went to him and removed the stone with a piece of the bladder, so that the man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I myself was called to remove that stone, and I saw that because of the size of the stone and the condition of the patient, I knew beforehand that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another physician who was receiving payment from a duke in our land for surgery, and he treated a dark-skinned man whose leg was fractured; and through his ignorance, the physician improperly set the fracture, placing splints and bandages with excessive tightness, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he (the physician) treated it according to his desires, and then he bound it, and then he left it for some days and commanded that we loosen the bandage.  And it remained like that until the leg and foot became abscessed, and resulted in death.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and I prepared to loosen the bandage, and tranquility was achieved and he was relieved of his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But meanwhile, corruption had already taken hold in the limb, so I could not stop it, and the corruption continued to spread in the limb until the patient died.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another physician who opened a cancerous abscess, and it festered for a few days, until the severity of the illness increased with the patient's suffering.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Because the cancerous tumor is purely made of melancholic humor, it is not appropriate to treat it with iron altogether, but rather to target the limb that suffers most from its presence.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And therefore, children, it is necessary for you that the operation with the hands be divided into two parts: one is the operation that is associated with health, and the other the work that entails danger in the most serious cases.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already highlighted this throughout this book in which operations are fraught with error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to guard against this and abandon it, lest the pages find a way to speak and discredit you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	Therefore, take your tools with diligence and with God's protection, and your patients with ease and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best method, through God's grace, aiming for health and laudable success, and leave the terrible illnesses of difficult healing, and remove from your arsenal whatever makes you fear, so that your reputation and your name are not tarnished: for it is more important to your glory, and higher in the world, and later to your holiness.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gualia already said in some of his pronouncements:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat a serious illness, lest you be called bad doctors".
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begins the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter, ordered from head to foot, on the forms of instruments and the tools for cauteries, and what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on cutting and piercing, and cupping, and cauteries, and the extraction of arrows and similar things, all chaptered and ordered according to the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and the treatment of twisting and similar injuries; a chapter ordered from head to foot, and concerning the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cauterization with fire and with sharp medicine and a record of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that begins the treatise of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	It is necessary for me to describe the benefits of this cauterization and its harms, and in what constitution cauterization is forbidden.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the discussion of the benefits and harms of cauterization is long and drawn out, subtle in its science, and a hidden secret; and already a great multitude of wise men have spoken of it, disagreeing on it, but I will suffice with a small portion of their discussions, fearing to be too lengthy.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cauterization is beneficial to all constitutions universally, whether with or without material causes, except for two constitutions, which are hot constitutions without material causes.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the hot and dry constitution with material causes, there is disagreement; for some say that cauterization is helpful in that case, and others say the opposite, that cauterization is not appropriate for an illness characterized by heat and dryness, because the nature of fire is heat and dryness, and it is inappropriate for a hot and dry illness to be treated with something that is hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who say the opposite argue that cauterization is beneficial in all hot and dry illnesses affecting the human body, because when you compare the human body and its humours to the constitution of fire, you find the human body to be cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say, concerning this matter, that experience has shown me this to be true on several occasions.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, this should not be taken as a final word on the subject by someone who is already skilled and experienced in the practice of cauterization, having learned about the diversity of human constitutions, the nature of illnesses themselves, their causes, their symptoms, and the proper timing for treatment.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in other constitutions, there is no need for such caution, especially in cold and moist illnesses, for all physicians have agreed upon their treatment and do not disagree about the use of cauterization in those cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that the secret of healing by cauterization with fire, and its effectiveness, is due to cauterization using fire as a medicine which is more effective, because fire is simple, its effect reaching only the part being cauterized and not harming other connected parts except with minor damage.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	However, the action of a burning medicine reaches the parts of the body further away from it, and easily causes a difficult-to-heal illness and substantial harm.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But fire, due to its intensity and the goodness of its substance, does not do this; rather, it is redundant.  And this is known to us through experience and long study of the art, the truth of causes; therefore I am excused from a lengthy discourse. And if it were not for the fact that this is not appropriate for a book on this matter, the secret of the use of fire, and the method of its operation within the body, and the expelling of diseases, would be demonstrated by a philosophical discourse, which would be more useful to you.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, children, that they disagree on the time when cauterization is best, and consider the spring the most favorable time.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cauterization is suitable at all times, because the harm caused by the passing of time is outweighed by the benefit derived from the cauterization, especially if the cauterization is for painful or necessary ailments, severe and sudden, which cannot tolerate delay, since the fear of greater harm resulting from the passage of time outweighs the minor harm from the cauterization itself.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And this is not understood by you, children, or is not valued by the common people and foolish doctors, which is that a disease cured by cauterization is not always a return to health, and they ignore this consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the reason is not at all as they believe, for cauterization is only a means of medicine that alters the temperament and dries the moistures which cause the pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	However, cauterization is superior to other medicine because of its power, the effectiveness of its action, and the greatness of its effect.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the ailment will return at some point in time, according to the temperament of the patient, the location of the illness, the patient's constitution, and the accumulation of superfluities within them, and what they have acquired through their diet and similar causes; however, if the illness for which cauterization was administered is a subtle ailment of a limb with few superfluities and moistures, similar to a toothache and the like, then it is possible that the pain will not return, but this happens with small amounts.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And a common saying is that cauterization is the last resort in medicine, and it is a true statement, not for what they understand by it, for they believe that there is no cure that benefits with medicine or any other treatment before cauterization.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	But the opposite is true; the idea that cauterization is the last resort in medicine is only when we have tried other methods of treatment for certain illnesses, and those medicines have not been effective, and finally, cauterization is applied, and it benefits from that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And therefore, cauterization being the last resort in medicine is not according to the understanding of common people and many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients would say that cauterization with gold is better than cauterization with iron, and they did not say this except for the equivalence of gold and the nobility of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they would say that the place where the cauterization is done does not matter, though this is not entirely true, for I have tested this and found that it only holds for some bodies and not others, and cauterization with gold is good and better than with iron, as they said; however, when you do cauterization with gold, it is not entirely clear to you, for it is heated according to the amount that you want by the heat of the gold, and it is prepared to receive cold; and if you add more fire, the gold melts due to the fire, and some pieces fall into the fire, and so the artisan may be harmed by the process.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	Therefore, cauterization with iron is done more easily and more properly for the correctness of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have organized this chapter on cauterization according to sections, and I have arranged them from the head to the feet, so that the patient may find what they desire.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cauterization for headaches caused by cold and dampness.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization is effective against dampness and coldness affecting the brain, the causes of which are twofold:  a cause of phlegm and a multitude of rheumatic fluxes, called cold, running from the head to the eye and ear areas; a multitude of sleeping problems; toothaches and throat pain; and generally all illnesses caused by cold, such as paralysis, apoplexy, and similar maladies.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cauterization is as follows:  first, instruct the patient to be purged with laxative medicine, thoroughly cleansing the head, for three or four nights, according to the patient's strength, age, and custom.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	Then instruct them to shave their head, and then position them on a smooth bench with their hands resting on their feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the blade of your palm, close to the bridge of the nose, between their eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, when the middle finger has reached the spot, mark the area with a branding iron, and then apply the oiled cautery, the method for which is as follows:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then apply that [cautery] to the marked spot, in a descending manner, with your hand gradually tightening and turning it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand slightly and examine the area.  If you see a significant amount of bone exposed, about the size of a grain of millet, then lift your hand, and if not, re-apply the iron, another one if necessary, until you see what I have described.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	Then take a bit of salt and dissolve it over the area, and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then place a cloth soaked in broth over it and leave it until the scab from the cautery is gone.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the area with a four-herb ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And if the wound remains open, the arm should be lifted, for this is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the bone should be cauterized down to the bone, and the cautery should be held until some part of the bone tissue is charred.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then that which is charred of the bone should be scraped off, and then it should be healed.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that with the cautery, one should reach the back, so that it presses hard on the bone until the bone breaks, and this is the method of a small cauterization.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that vapors from the head are released from that location.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And let the wound be kept open for a long time, and then be treated until it is healed and consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	However, I have not seen these two types of cauterization in all cases, but only in some individuals, according to the route of caution; and in my opinion, it is better to preserve health, when possible; for the head is weakened by a disruption of its continuity, just as we have witnessed in other parts of the body, especially when the patient's head is of a fragile nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cauterization is safer and better in my opinion; and by this method and this work, health is preserved.
Capitol segon.	Second Chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of cauterization of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When a chronic and prolonged headache afflicts the patient, and they have used leeches, cupping, head purges, plasters, washes, poultices, and similar remedies, and especially if they have already been cauterized with a cauterization technique that doesn't benefit them, then consider if the patient's head is of strong constitution, not fragile, and is experiencing extreme cold, then one should cauterize with another cauterization technique slightly below the previous one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that area above the patient's temple with a cautery until the inflammation is broken.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Incise the inflammation and expose the bone, the quantity of which we have described, and cauterize it with a cautery in the back part of the head, in the area called the *vas* (vein) – and this is the area where a cupping vessel is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And ease your hand in doing this, and do not expose the bone, for the patient will experience very great pain different from the pain of all other head cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I will describe this cautery in its place, for the cautery used for cauterizing the temples and the back of the head must be a finer cautery than the one used for cauterizing the middle part of the head; and this is the method for it.
Capitol ters.	Third Chapter.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Concerning the cauterization of non-ancient migraine.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When, in the head's area, there is persistent or spreading pain extending to the eye, the head should be cleansed with medicines, and the other treatment I have described in my discussion of illnesses should be administered.  If this does not help, cauterization is performed in two ways: either with a sharp, burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	But cauterization with a burning medicine is when you take an onion, squeeze it, and cut the ends off both of its ends.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then, using a sharp lancet, cut the painful area on the temple until a small depression is created beneath the skin, until it is hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then, press on it with a bandage to constrict the area, and leave it for three hours. Then, remove it and take away the onion, and leave the wound for two or three days, and then apply cotton soaked in butter until the area heals.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do this with some burning medicines, which I have written in the second treatise on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	But cauterization with iron according to this method:  apply fire for cauterization, of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a 'nail' (or 'clavilh'), because its head is like the shape of a nail, in which there is some curvature, and in the middle of it there is a small eminence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then place it over the painful area, and hold your hand—so that the surrounding flesh is not burned—and turn the small iron slowly and with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount burned by the intensity of the cautery is about half of it, then lift your hand to prevent the underlying artery from being burned, so that no blood flow occurs.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then soak cotton in salt water and place it over the area, and leave it for three days; then place cotton moistened with butter, and then treat with ointment until healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you wish, cauterize with the blade of a knife (like a cautery), and be careful not to cut an artery in this particular, not-ancient, form of migraine.
Capitol quart.	Fourth Chapter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Concerning the cauterization of ancient migraine.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat a migraine with what we have described in the previous treatment, and what we have discussed in the divisions of illnesses, and the treatment is ineffective, and sometimes the illness prevents the patient from benefiting from what we have previously described - the first cauterization with medicine or with fire - then you should heat the knife cautery until it glows white-hot, then apply it to the pain area in a line of half a finger's length, or as needed;  and place your hand there once, pressing firmly until you cut into the artery and reach the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be careful not to harm the continuity of the jaw, which is strained by chewing, and that the ligament and nerves that control it are not damaged, and that spasm does not result.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it concerns the guarding and caution against blood flow from the severed artery, for there is fear in its severance, especially for one who is ignorant of what they are doing and is not skilled and experienced; and leaves the operation unfinished at the start.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come back to the treatment of accidental blood flow from the artery in its proper manner in its place in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this treatment is not sufficient for this ailment, and the patient's condition appears tolerable, cauterize the middle of the head as we have described, and treat the wound until it heals.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, apply the cautery that we mentioned in the chapter on artery constriction with a cautery having two blades; this is a better and more beneficial cauterization.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Concerning the cauterization of earaches.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When an earache is caused by cold and is treated with laxatives and the other remedies mentioned in the division, and the pain persists, then apply the cautery, and this is the one called *puncta*, whose shape is as follows:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then, apply the heated cautery point by point around the entire ear, moving in a circular motion, or in sections if the pain is localized in a specific area.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Move the cautery along the base of the ear slowly, after marking the location with a probe.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery has ten points across the whole ear, use that many, and then treat the affected areas until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cauterization of tumors.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Tumors that are cured by cauterization are only of the types that arise from phlegm, as we have stated in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the type caused by dryness or nerve spasm.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that type of tumor with poultices, purges, and remedies, and your treatment is ineffective, then you must cauterize the patient with three cauteries: one at the root of the ear, a second one a little below the temple, and a third at the junction of the two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery opposite the diseased area, for softening occurs only on the area that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the method of cauterization is to cauterize with the cautery at the right of the ear's extremity, slightly above the corner of the head, and another one at the temple, the length of which should be according to the length of the index finger, and hold the cautery until the affected area has been burned to half its thickness.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cautery, and it is a type of surgical instrument, the form of which is described before.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it is even more subtle than that which you see; and it is necessary to cut away some of the superfluous thickness in that area.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with what was previously described until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On the cauterization of old apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is longstanding and you have treated it with what we have said, and you do not see improvement in the treatment, and the patient has no fever, then cauterize with four cauteries: on all the corners of the head; and with a cautery on the middle part of the head, as we have said; and with a cautery on the jaw.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the method of cauterization is done as described above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized on the opening of the stomach; and further back; and then it should be treated with what follows.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Concerning cauterization for forgetfulness caused by flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Large jars and pills, which cleanse the brain, should be given to the patient at the beginning.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then shave the patient's entire head and apply a plaster of ceter, as described in the treatise on plasters, to their temples.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And apply that several times, for that is a form of cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And do this according to the same order that I have already stated.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And so, if that is a good cure, then do this.  But if not, then make three cauteries on the back part of their head, descending from the highest part of the head to the lowest part of the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place the width of a finger between each cautery, and then treat the cautery with whatever was previously mentioned.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	However, if the application is slight and the patient tolerates it, then make the cautery in the middle; and if there is greater need, then cauterize that area over the two horns.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then treat it until it is healed; and let the cautery be oiled, according to the form previously given.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Concerning cauterization for paralysis and the softening of the entire body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	You should proceed with cleansing the head with herbs and as previously described; then shave the patient's head, and then cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head, and with a cautery on each horn of the head, and with a cautery on the back part of the head, and with three cauteries on the spinal vertebrae of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if, in the illness of softening of the body, the patient is particularly weak and the illness is severe, then cauterize with four cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and continuously with a cautery until the pain has lessened significantly, and lift your hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then treat him until he is healed, and this should be an olive oil cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	Of cauterization for epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	The epileptic is not cauterized unless the epilepsy is caused by phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	Therefore, it is necessary to modify his brain at the beginning, using herbs and other treatments we have described in the division when the patient is seriously ill and tolerates the use of strong medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who cannot tolerate the medicines, then administer remedies and mastigators that modify the brain, beforehand for several days, with the proper preparation of foods.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then shave the patient's head, and then cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head according to the previous method, and with another cautery at the back of the head, and cauterize on each temple (horn of the head).
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the illness is severe and the patient can tolerate it, then cauterize the patient with the cauteries I have described, having simultaneously paralysis and softening of the body on the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	Let the cautery be olive-shaped, as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then use a gentle cautery according to this method.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humidity and a large flame, then cauterize it with the cauteries that we have described in the previous paralysis section.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is a superfluity tending towards melancholy, and the patient's body is moist, then give him to drink what cleanses his brain, according to what has been previously stated in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then shave the patient's head, and then carefully apply a properly made torquet to it around the circumference, and then place it over the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient should be seated securely, and held firmly in all parts.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply a liniment; and it is better to use an old sheep's wool.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat that over a fire with a measured, moderate heat, which the said person can tolerate when it is placed upon them.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then pour it onto the center of their head, inside the circle, and leave it until it has cooled.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this to the patient once a week, with the rest of their treatment, until they are healed; or if you wish, cauterize that area by making small points according to their ability, holding the hand with a cautery that is thus ordered: this is a type of cautery that moistens the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place that cloth soaked in wool or hen's grease.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of the cauterization of descending water in the head.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have determined the beginning of water in the head by the signs I have described in the division, then begin and give the patient to drink that which will dry the head, and protect it from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And make him sweat in a bath for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	And then command him to shave his head, and cauterize it with a cautery in the middle part of the head; and then cauterize it with two cauteries on both temples if the beginning of water-disease is in both ears, or on one side if the beginning of the water-disease is in one ear.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Cut with cauteries all the veins and arteries which are below the scalp; and let the cauteries be of that length in the width of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And watch out for blood flow when it is cauterized; and if you see blood flow from it, stop it with any medicine that is possible for you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will come with the skill that is in the extraction of arteries and with the excision of those and the precaution against blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized on the neck below two bones with two cauteries directly applied.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of the cauterization of old sores/wounds.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When sores on the face are old, persistent, and run through the veins and arteries visible on the outside of the head, and it is verified that this is due to cold phlegmatic superfluities, then cauterize it with the cautery we described in the chapter on hot water compresses for sores, and with a cautery in the middle of the head, and with two cauteries on the neck below the temples, and with two cauteries on the neck below the bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if more treatment is needed, then cauterize along the entire edge of the sore on the eyebrow's extremity with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of the cauterization of nasal discharge/foul odor.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	If your treatment using the methods we discussed is ineffective, then prepare and give the patient a potion to drink for three nights; then shave the patient's head and cauterize it with a middling cautery and an olive cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then cauterize it with a clove cautery, using two cauteries on the two eyebrows below the hair, a small one.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to set it on fire.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the method for the clove cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of cauterization for softening the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid is softened by illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery using this lunar cautery; and this is its method:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, cauterize that slightly on both eyebrows, using two cauteries on each spot, and keep them spaced from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the size of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand with the cautery too hard, but just enough so that the third part of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of cauterization of the eyelid of the eye when the hairs are turned inwards and the eye is inflamed.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs of the eye are turned inward, causing inflammation of the eye, cauterization in such cases is done in two ways: either with a cautery iron or with a burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If with a cautery of fire, instruct the patient beforehand to shave the hairs as those who clean them, until they are lengthened and straightened; and if the inflammation is near the roots of the hair, then you should press the patient's eyes with a bandage so they don't move until the hair has grown back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	So, once the hairs are grown back and straightened, then place the patient's head on your lap, and gently apply a cautery to the eyelid of their eye using a probe, whose shape should be similar to a myrtle leaf, starting the cautery near the hairs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then place cotton soaked in egg white or in a ptilli mucilage over the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then apply the cautery, of which this is its form/shape.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize, little by little, in several applications, over the area you marked, until the surface of the inflamed area, which is roughly the shape of a myrtle leaf, is completely charred.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The sign of successful treatment is that you see the eyelid drawn together and the hairs rising towards the puncture in the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then lift your hand and leave it for three days, and then place cotton with a border over it until the scab has healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if, due to some cause, hair growth returns near the origin and the eyelid softens, then apply the cautery again in the same manner as you did at first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are under the eyelid, then cauterize it until they are raised to their natural position, healed, and the hairs no longer irritate the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with burning medicine that you prescribe to the patient involves pulling the hairs out until they are elongated and healed, and then a piece of cloth shaped like a myrtle leaf should be applied.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take known herb and fresh living vinegar, or whatever is appropriate, and thoroughly mix these ingredients quickly so they don't get cold.  Then spread this mixture onto the cloth shaped like a myrtle leaf, and place this over the affected eye(s).  Place a cloth soaked in albumen of an egg under the eye, and the patient's head should be supported.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And press the cloth onto the medicine, pressing it gently, but do not remove it until the patient feels the medicine's burning sensation, for the burning sensation is like that of fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And thus, as long as the patient feels the burning sensation, leave the medicine in place.  Then, when the burning sensation stops, remove the medicine and wash the eye with water.  Then consider if the eyelid is now raised as it should be, without constriction from fire or incision. If so, it is well done. If not, return to applying the medicine to the affected area and continue until the healing is complete, and the eye is closed.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then apply a cloth over the area until the burn's inflammation has subsided, and then treat it with a healing ointment or other appropriate remedy until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	It is necessary for you, during your treatment, to carefully watch that nothing of the medicine gets into the eye.  And if after a few days the eyelid becomes softened and something of the hair or skin gets into the eye, then reapply your medicine to the softened area of the eyelid, just as you did at the beginning, and continue until it heals.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the method of using myrtle leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	Know that human eyes differ in size and thus the treatment for their condition is adjusted accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the path to recovery for the one who studies this art will not be hidden.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of the cauterization of a fistula in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula, as we have discussed in the divisions of illnesses, and your treatment doesn't work, then you should cauterize it in this way: instruct the patient to rest their head on your lap, and have an assistant hold the patient's head between your hands, so that it is neither moved nor agitated by their head movements.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place a piece of cotton, soaked in egg white or phlli gum, over their eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then heat the cautery, whose form is:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be hollow, like the shape of a reed or a hawk's feather, at the end from which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, let it penetrate to the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you wish, let it be slender, like a probe.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, the one that is hollow is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is open, and drain and dry it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and remove the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place the heated cautery on it, and hold your hand a short distance from the cautery, near the nostril, so that your hand or the patient is not disturbed, and then place the cautery on the ulcer and cauterize it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And therefore, if at the beginning your cautery penetrates to the bone, it is good; and if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice, if necessary; and leave it thus for three days, and then apply a bandage with lint and surround it with a drying ointment until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if more than ten days have passed and it is not healed, then apply a sharp, corrosive medicine until the bone is exposed and is scraped as appropriate in your chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another method of cauterizing a fistula, which some earlier practitioners described:  Apply pressure to the fistula opening and make it wider. Then place a thin piece of lead, shaped as is described, into that opening; hold it in place with your hand firmly, so that the molten lead does not enter the wound; you should apply a bandage soaked in egg white or water to the patient's wound, as the lead will adhere to the fistula opening and heal it, bringing remarkable recovery.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed by the cauterization and treatment we have described, it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to administer a perforation of the nose and reduce the fistula back into the nasal passage, according to its proper location.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	Concerning the cauterization of a fissure in the pot/cavity.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Often fissures occur in the lips, especially in the lips of children.

E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And its cavity should be according to the sharpness of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then carefully place that heated cautery on those fissures until the cautery reaches the bottom of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with a plaster until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of cauterization of fistulas in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an abscess forms at the base of the uvula, or on the palate, or at the roots of the teeth, and it breaks, and then becomes chronic, and pus forms and a fistula is created, and you treat it but the treatment doesn't work, then you must apply a cautery according to the size of the fistula opening.  Place the heated cautery into the opening of the fistula, and hold your hand there until the heated iron reaches the bottom of it. This is done once or twice. Then treat it with the methods we've previously discussed for healing until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And therefore, if the pus is expelled and healed, it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to expose the area and remove the damaged bone, as will be described in its appropriate chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cauterization of the teeth and softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are decayed, and treatment with medicines does not help, then place the patient's head on your lap.  Then heat the cautery, the shape of which will be explained here.  Position the cannula over the tooth and quickly insert the heated cautery into it. Hold your hand there for a short time, so that the patient feels the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then remove your hand, and repeat the cauterization a few times, as desired.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then have the patient fill their mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, then spit it out.  For the decayed tooth is sealed, the softened gums are strengthened, and the corrupt moisture is dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of cauterization for toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is caused by cold, or there is cold or a worm in it, or you do not consider medicine a cure, then cauterization in that case is done in two ways: either with a cow's dung cautery, or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization with dung is done by taking cow dung, boiling it in an iron pot, then taking a piece of cloth, wrapping it around the end of a probe, dipping it into the boiled dung, and quickly placing it on the aching tooth until it is cooled.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeat this several times until the heat's effect reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you wish, dip wool or cloth in the aforementioned dung, place it on the aching tooth, and place the heated iron upon it until the iron reaches the hollow of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, cauterization with fire is that you use a heated iron or bronze cannula, ensuring that its thickness is sufficient to prevent the heat from reaching the patient's mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then heat the cautery, shaped appropriately, and place it on the tooth, holding it until the cautery cools; repeat this several times, as the pain will either cease that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary that, during the application of the cautery, the patient fill their mouth with good dung and hold it for an hour, then spit it out; and this is the method of cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize whichever extremity you are able to.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the cannula:

Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema. De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	Of cauterization of the titillic, which is the head of the help/aid.
