Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	You should place the needle at the end of the thread near the exterior part, and make it penetrate to the interior in that same place, and leave the two ends of the thread; and then turn the needle and make it penetrate from the exterior to the interior in the two ends of the thread.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	And then turn each of those, and make each penetrate from the interior to the exterior in two other ends of the thread that are on the opposite side.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this manner of suture is better than the common, simple suture, and is the suture of which the previous remedy spoke.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the Gaulish method.
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And some may say, the suture of the belly is rectified with two needles; this means that you insert a thread into each of these, and begin with the insertion of the needle from your side, and make it penetrate to the other side according to the suture of those who know the skins equally.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And know that when the rupture is in the middle of the belly, then the suture there is more difficult than in other parts of the belly.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	But the judgment of the treatment of plague is the judgment of the other plagues.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	Which means that when you catch the plague fresh, with its blood before the air alters it, and you return the intestines and stitch it up and prepare it properly, then apply a flesh-forming powder to it.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already altered the plague, then apply some ointments which you have on hand until they form a hard stone and the fibers fall out, and be consolidated and observed; then treat it just as you would treat other plagues until it is healed.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	But if you do not have the medicines on hand, then apply immediately, as soon as it begins to cast off pus, a strong poultice, and change it twice a day, as you were taught, until it is healed, for you will not need other treatment in many cases when the plagues are simple.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	But if you fear that the plague will spread to the major limbs, then you must soak some linen in oil of tempered quality, or in warmed oil, and place that around the areas between the ribs and under the armpits.
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	And if he feels pain or putrefaction in his bowels, for this often happens, then cauterize it with black astringent wine, especially if the ulcer has penetrated into the cavity of his bowel and has made a penetrating exit.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	And know that that which is in the large intestine is easier to heal than that which is in the small intestines.
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	And it is difficult to heal, for the intestine called "jejunum" does not receive healing from a plague that settles upon it completely; and this is because of the large multitude of veins within it, and because of its size, and because of the subtlety of its body, and because of its proximity to the nature of nerves.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	But if what arises from the plague is a membrane, and you obtain it fresh, reduce it according to your technique for reducing the intestines as well.
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	But if it has spread to the surrounding area and it is already green or black, then you should compress that area with a cloth over the blackened spot, to bring about blood flow, for there are veins and arteries in the membrane.
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	And then cut what is beside that ligament, and hang the two ends of the cloth over the area below the plague, so that the pull from the affected area towards the joining of the membrane and the emission of the plague's arm is lessened.
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	A reminder of the plagues when they occur in the intestine.
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	When a rupture occurs in the intestine, and it is small, it is possible for it to be restored in some individuals.  For example, I saw a man who had been injured in his abdomen by a spear thrust, and the plague was on the right side of the stomach. The plague was old, and had formed a fistula, and expelled gas and wind.
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	Then I considered his treatment, though I was not confident in his recovery, but I continued to treat it until it was healed and the area was consolidated.
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	And after I saw the area healed, I observed the patient for any further abdominal problems.  No further complications arose, and he remained in his usual state of health, eating and drinking, and then bathed and engaged in his activities.
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	And some experienced individuals have said that when a small intestinal injury occurs, it should be treated in this way: you should take large-headed leeches; then, join the two edges of the wound, and place one of these leeches with an open mouth on the two edges of the wound.  Then, when it has attached itself and closed its mouth, sever the leech’s head, because it adheres and is not released.
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	Then place another leech near the first, and do not stop doing this with leeches, one after the other, according to the size of the whole wound.
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	Then reduce the swelling and the wound; and those leech heads remain attached to the intestine until the intestine is healed; and no harm comes to the patient.
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	And it is possible that the intestine be joined with a thin thread, which is made from the intestine of an animal, joined to it, after it has been put through a needle; and you should take the end of this intestinal thread, and it should be very lean, and then tie that end to the injured intestine, wrapped around it, and then thread that thread through needles and stitch the intestine together, and reduce that into the rupture.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	And this method of suturing with leeches is only according to a way of trust and hope.
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	However, if the wound is large and extensive, especially if it is in one of the delicate intestines, for then there is no remedy but subtlety, and there is no complete healing of it.
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	Of the treatment of ulcers and fistulas.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	Know that any wound or abscess, when it ages and becomes old, and has become an ulcer, and is not healed and continues to discharge pus constantly and is not incised, then, in any limb, is universally called a fistula, and we call that an ulcer.
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	And a fistula, according to truth, is a hardened, tough, whitish knot, with which there is no pain, and which has a cavity just like the cavity of a bird's nest; and therefore we call that an ulcer, called "rized ulcer," or  "nest ulcer.
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	And in some people it is moist, which discharges pus; and very easily the moisture is incised in a few hours.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	And sometimes this moisture is thick, and is thin, and is large, and is subtle.
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	And I have already stated before, in the division, when I spoke of wounds, that any ulcer that is not healed, nor is on healthy flesh, is not so due to one of these causes: either due to lack of blood in the body; or due to malice in the patient; or because between the ulcer and the healthy flesh there is hard, obstructing flesh preventing the healing of the flesh; or because it is of a very weak constitution; or because the ulcer itself has rotted, and the matter sent to it is of poor quality; or because the medicine is inappropriate in its treatment; or because corruption has taken hold in the region, and it is pestilence; or due to the property of the region, as in Zaragoza, where the digestion of diseases is difficult, and the healing of the abscess is delayed by nature; or because there is one bone, or many bones, in the area.
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	I have already shown all those causes, and the signs of them, and their treatment with medicines in the division.
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And it is necessary that I make known to you the treatment of a fistula, which is done by means of surgery with a hand.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	And know that fistulas occur in all parts of the body; for some fistulas reach the major veins and arteries, or the nerves, or the spinal cord, or the intestines, or the bladder, or to any of the ribs, or to any of the vertebrae of the spine, or to any of the compound joints, such as the wrist and ankle, and others that affect the area close to the main limb and similar locations.
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	And therefore, those fistulas that are in this manner are among the difficult-to-heal illnesses, and do not receive a cure; and to work on them with ignorance is useless effort.
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	And if there is any fistula whose depth does not reach these locations that I have mentioned, and you hope and trust in its cure, and wish to gain knowledge of it, then try with a probe or an iron, and if the fistula goes in a straight line, follow it with the probe.
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	But if the fistula is winding, then investigate it with a probe of fine lead, for lead, with the lightness of its substance, is easily bent towards the winding path.
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	And if the fistula has many horrifications, it is not possible for you to mark it with a probe.
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Then irrigate the orifices through their orifices, for the moisture with which you irrigate it will travel to the other openings and run through them.
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	And then inquire meticulously, by whatever means you can, to know if there are bones or nerves, and whether the fistula's cavity is distant or close, or whether it is a fistula with many openings, and consider all this with all your strength, with your questioning, with which you question the patient, and the location of the pain by pressing with your hand on the area, and the meanings and causes of the abscess.
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	And when you have considered all these factors with true judgment, then proceed to treatment according to your judgment: and you must now consider whether the fistula is a superficial, close, or exposed fistula; or one in a salty area, distant from a joint, or a nerve, or an artery, or a vein, or one of the places I have told you.
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then dry the fistula as previously described, and remove what is in that filtering process and the corrupted flesh, and what has arisen in the opening of the flesh, or of pus and the like, and treat it until it is healed.
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	But if the fistula is deep and extensive, then it must be incised to the best of your ability, and then cleanse it of all its corrupted flesh; then apply some bandages of sharp medicines and insert them into the fistula cavity, which you have opened with an iron instrument.
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	And do this repeatedly until the sharp medicine has corroded all that is rotten in the fistula's cavity.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	And then restore it with ointments that generate healthy flesh until it is healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	But if it is not healed by this, then cauterize it as we have described.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	However, if the cause of the fistula is bone, and you are certain of this, then you should investigate and dry it as we have described, unless you see any reason to avoid affecting a vein, nerve, or major limb, as we have said.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is exposed and there is any corruption or blackness on it, then you must scrape it until all the corruption is removed; and then treat it with something to make it flesh again until it is healed.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it is not healed and still discharges pus as before, then know that you have not fully eradicated the corruption; and then you must expose it again carefully, thoroughly scrape and clean it with your strongest tools, and then restore it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And if it is healed, good; but if not, then know that the corruption is deep within the body, beyond your reach, and in that case, there is no remedy but to leave it.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the corrupted bone is small, or it is possible for you to remove it, then you should remove it with thin forceps suitable for this.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if there are many bones, then carefully remove all of them, and leave nothing behind with your strength.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if any moisture causes you difficulty, and there is no fear or mistake in their incision, then cut those ligaments or flesh if there are any, and free the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if you are not prepared to remove the bones immediately, then place something over the wound that might protect it, and leave it until it is surrounded by flesh and ligaments, and keep the wound from healing, so that the incision you made in your operation is contained.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	However, if you are concerned, place on it cotton soaked in crushed oil, or cotton soaked in Egyptian ointment, or in some other green ointment, because when those ligaments soften, and the bones are separated from them, the removal and extraction will be easier.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	But if there is a large bone, like a leg bone or thigh bone or similar, and only the surface is corrupted, then cut that with a rasp until the blackness and corruption are removed, and then restore the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	However, if the corrupted portion is large, and the corruption has reached the bone marrow, then it is necessary to cut that entire area, cutting into the spot where the corruption has spread, and then treating that until it heals.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I will tell you what happened to a man in his thigh, so that you may use it as an example and aid in your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	There was a young man, around 30 years of age, who experienced pain in his thigh, and from the parts within the body, the matter spread until it reached the thigh, and it was a matter of an abscess with a large abscess, and it was not an external cause.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And so the time passed with that, through the doctors' error, until the abscess opened, and a lot of matter escaped, and its cure was delayed until the leg became fistulaed, and many openings appeared in it, which all discharged pus and the body's humors.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	Then a multitude of doctors treated him for about two years, and none of them were truly skillful in the art, until I was called.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And I saw his leg and the matter flowing from those openings, a great deal of it; and the man's entire body was emaciated, and his complexion was yellowish.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	Then I inserted a probe into one of those openings, and the probe reached the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	And I then probed all the openings, and found them to extend to all parts of the leg.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	Then I carefully incised one of those openings until I exposed a part of the bone, and found it decayed, already earthy and corrupted and blackened; and a part of the leg was already decayed, having penetrated down to the marrow.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	Then I closed what I had uncovered and prepared of the exposed bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I concluded that it was not in the bone itself, but that corruption which I had cut away and closed, and I had already cured it.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	And then I applied restorative medicine for a long time, but it did not heal.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then I reopened and exposed the bone again, on top of the first exposure, and found continued decay with the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And I removed what seemed to be that decay, and then I was forced to perform the cure and restoration, and it was not restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And then I exposed it again, and I did not stop cutting the bone little by little, specifically, and forced its restoration, but it was not restored until I cut around a hand's breadth of it, and extracted that with its marrow, and then I restored it with medicines, and it was slightly consolidated and healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And no further repetition of the operation and section is needed except for the weakness of the patient, and due to their little tolerance and fear of death, for in the patient, there occurred at all times a harmful syncope (fainting) due to the excess of evacuation.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	Therefore, it is completely healed, and there is no hard, fleshy tissue in place of the bone; and its condition in the body is now good, and its strength has returned; and it has been restored to its original condition, and it experiences no difficulty in walking or harm in any way.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	However, if the bone is prominent in a part of the body already fractured, then you must cut it in this way: take a bandage and tightly bind it to the end of the protruding bone, and order someone to pull on it; then place a thicker wool bandage over the first bandage; then bind that over the flesh below the bone, and pull on the end so that you draw the flesh down, and expose the flesh over the place where you wish to cut, so that the cut does not damage the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And place a stick or board under the bone properly, for when you do this, the cut will not be prevented from cutting the corrupted flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And the incision should be made over the corrupted area little by little, for if the corruption is within the cavity of the bone and does not appear on its surface to the touch, it may need to be incised again.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is corrupt but not protruding, with one part still connected to the other, and the corruption is in the middle or a portion of it, then you must uncover all the surrounding flesh; and then place a stick underneath, and then cut from the first part where the corruption is until the cut continues to the other part.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And let the incision be made along the location of the corruption, a little at a time, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, cut that corrupted joint, and saw the bone where it is connected to the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuity of two joints, then it is not in a rational place but is unnatural.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the flesh of the hand or foot, it is very difficult; however, you must investigate the corruption in whatever manner appears to you, and expose it, and clean it according to any possible disposition, and with whatever ingenuity is available to you, so long as it does not impede or injure a vein or nerve.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And know that the incisions and saws used to cut these bones are very much dependent on the location of the bones, their preparation, their thickness, their subtlety and size, and their hardness and rarity. Therefore, you must prepare suitable instruments for every type of operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And understand that this operation demands knowledge of the specific instruments you will need; for great study, long experience, and understanding of the methods of this art, and experience with illnesses, are necessary, so that you yourself know what instruments are appropriate for every illness.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And I am now providing you, at the end of this chapter, a list of the instruments you will use, along with simple instructions, to perform the procedures that you will then test on others.
Forma de serra:	Shape/form of saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Shape/form of another saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Shape of another saw:
Forma de autra serra gran:	Shape of another large saw:
Forma de ray:	Shape of a ray (or: ray's form).
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	Let the head of this ray be shaped like a star-shaped keyhead, and its points be shaped like those of a starburst.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is not fitting except that with that [the ray/star shape] the heads of the joints are cauterized when they are corrupted, or if the opening is large and wide.
Forma de razori major dels autres:	Shape of a larger razor than the others.
Forma de razori menor:	Shape of a smaller razor.
Forma de razori lat:	Shape of a side/lateral razor.
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	The shape of another properly made saw:  a bow should be made of the strongest material and its sharpness of iron, and its handle of well-made wood.
Forma de lu:	Shape of it (the saw).
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	Shape of a razor that has a concavity/curvature.
Forma de razori autra subtil:	Another subtle/delicate shape of a razor.
Forma de autra razori de curvada extremitat:	Shape of another razor with a curved end.
Forma de rasori petit semblant a tenta:	Shape of a small razor resembling a tentacle.
Forma de incisori am le qual so inscidit les osses:	Shape of a tool used for cutting bone.
Forma de inscisori autra minor:	Shape of another, smaller cutting tool.
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Shape of another cutting tool; this one resembling a ray, and its end is like a saw, and it is shown in many places in the treatise on bones.
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Shape of a ray that is appropriate for the study of bones that have been perforated.
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its tip is triangular and sharp-pointed.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, and similarly, all the things we have said about razors, cutting tools, and saws should be.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of the cutting edges and the saw-like aspects of the bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities [of the affected area] may be damaged either due to intrinsic or extrinsic causes, or if your treatment with these medications does not resolve the corruption, or if the corruption spreads to a limb that wasn't initially affected, then you must make incisions into that limb wherever the corruption has reached, so that the patient escapes death or a greater deterioration of the limb.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of the affected area is that the limb becomes black, as if fire had burned it, or the blackness spreads until the hardness reaches the limb and engulfs the whole body; then, operate with an incision on that area.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly, if the corruption is caused by the sting of venomous creatures, such as a scorpion, viper, or other similar creatures.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or injury is in the extremity of the finger, then you should incise the finger and prevent the corruption from spreading to the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly, if the affliction reaches the hand, then you should make an incision at the base of the forearm, and prevent the corruption from spreading to the arm's socket.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if that fails, then you should make an incision in the arm up to the elbow joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the corruption passes beyond the elbow, then death for the patient is certain; and to administer any other remedy for this is a futile act.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly, for the foot, when corruption reaches the toe, then you should incise it up to one of the joints.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it spreads to the sole of the foot, then you should incise the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it ascends to the knee, then you should incise the leg up to the knee joint.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already reached the knee, then there is no remedy but to allow the patient to die.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the method of incising or cutting the limb is that you should tighten the ligament in the area just below the part you want to cut, and tighten another ligament on the spot; and let the assistant pull a ligament downwards, and let another assistant pull a ligament upwards; and you separate the flesh that is between the two ligaments, holding it apart with a spatula until all the flesh is exposed; and then cut or sever it.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And it is necessary that a cloth be placed on all sides so that the area is not touched, and that the patient experiences a controlled, contained wound and abscess.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if you encounter a flow of blood during the operation, then you should cauterize the bleeding spot carefully, or place some blood-stopping powders on it; and then return to your procedure until it is finished.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the injured limb with a suitable bandage, and treat it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I relate to you what happened to a man on his foot, the same accident that I am relating to you, which is that he suffered a blackening on his foot, with a burn similar to a fire burn.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption began first in his toe until it spread to his entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then the man himself, seeing the treatment was not reaching the limb with the intensity he needed because of the pain and the burning, incised the foot right up to the joint, and it healed.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time, the same corruption happened to him on the tip of his index finger.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then he came to me, and I was forced to counteract that excess with what I could apply to his hand from among the medicines, to purify his body; but the excess was not counteracted, and it began to spread to the other fingers until it spread to his whole hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he urged me to cut his hand, but I did not want to do that, hoping for a counteraction of that excess, and more than fearing the death of his hand due to the incision, for the patient's strength was wavering.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And after he left me, he returned to his own land, and it came to me that this man had prepared himself and cut his entire hand, and it healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not related this story except so that it may be helpful in understanding this illness, and that it may be a sign by which it may be recognized and according to which it may be treated.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of the treatment of sinuses and the quality of clysterization with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess develops on a fleshy part of the body and the abscess cavity extends to collect pus, and it then bursts and is opened, and the pus comes out, leaving a hollow space like a vessel, and the skin covering it is thin, and has not progressed to further decay, and does not affect the bone, nerves, or ligaments, it is called a sinus, and not a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the cavity extends so that the decay affects any part of the body, then it is called a fistula and not a sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the treatment of it is to cut away that skin completely, as it is turned back, and especially when it is thin and like a cloth, and to make sure that it does not adhere to the area because of its decay.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you suspect that the skin is adhering and that the decay has not yet spread further, and there is a wound on the skin, then you treat it with a clyster.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And if you consider it a sinus, and if it is large, and the discharge has a foul odor, then administer a clyster with Egyptian medicine, which is made of oil, sour wine, and vinegar in equal parts, mixed in a vessel, heated over a fire until the medicine becomes thick and resembles honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	Then take what is necessary from it and dissolve it with water and honey; and administer this mixture as a clyster to the sinus, and tighten the opening, and leave the medicine there for two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then remove it with a compress; and do this for so many days until the sinus is cleansed and the odor is gone.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And sometimes, if this medicine isn't available, it's administered with water mixed with ashes.  Take the ashes from a fire, mix them with water, then strain it and administer this as a clyster until you are confident that the sinus is closed.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient cannot tolerate the Egyptian medicine or the ash water, then administer a clyster with water and honey, and some crushed vinegar mixed in, or a clyster with wine and honey mixed together, for honey's property is to cleanse and wash, and wine causes the sinus to adhere, especially when the wine has an excess of astringency and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you have done this several times and are confident that the sinus is healed, then administer a clyster with something that promotes the growth of flesh there.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And you should take diafinicon ointment, dissolve it in warmed oil and astringent wine; or administer a clyster with other medicines and ointments that have the properties which I have already written about in the treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the opening of the sinus is narrow, preventing the clyster tube from entering, then widen it gradually with a small iron tool, and apply heat wrapped in Egyptian or Basil ointment until it is widened.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly, if the opening is wide, then you should bring the lips of the wound together with stitches and leave them in a manner that allows the clyster tube to enter without difficulty.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the opening through which the fistula runs is elevated to the upper parts, then close it in the lowest area and allow the fistula to run downwards, for when the fistula is located deep within the sinus, the flesh will grow there.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if you cannot close the sinus down to the lower bone as desired, then force yourself to prepare the limb with a preparation so that the fistula runs easily as you have prepared, and so that no cause of the fistula is retained within it.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidating medicines suitable for this, and place them on a linen cloth over the sinus.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth should be large enough to cover the entire sinus; then, with scissors, cut a slightly wider opening in the cloth just above the opening of the sinus; then, spread some ointment on another linen cloth corresponding to the size of the opening, and place this over the first, keeping a distance from the sinus opening so that the fistula's discharge is facilitated.  Remove the large cloth only after a few days.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	But the one over the sinus opening, which remains at all times, so that what is accumulating within the fistula may exit.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you may know if the discharge from the fistula is copious or scant, or if it is digested or not.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And by this, consider the location of the sinus; if the patient feels pain there, and if an abscess is present.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And as your treatment extends in this way, and you see the matter that has collected over the sinus opening has adhered or is showing signs of adhesion, then, on the third day, detach it, and when you detach the scab, change the cloth and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if from the sinus a subtle, spreading virus has emerged, then do not despair of the adhesion, for healing in such cases tends to take time, as there are some people in whom the generation of flesh in their wounds is slow, and others in whom the opposite is true.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if from the sinus for many days undigested matter has emerged, then know that the sinus has not adhered; and if the adhesion of the sinus is delayed and the cause prolonged, then you should adjust the drying effects of the medicines, and if the medicines are moist in their substance and in their virtue, dry them like *unguentum diafinicon*, when the superfluous addition of pitch is adjusted to it.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the final remedy with which it is cured is to take *unguentum diafinicon*, dissolve it in warmed oil, and add ancient wine to it, which is thickened in its substance, and mix this together thoroughly, and use this remedy.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And similarly, in the absence of matter, use *unguentum diafinicon*, honey when it is heated until it is thickened, and apply this; or take myrrh, aloe, and frankincense, grind them all into powder over honey that has been heated on the fire, then spread this on a cloth and apply the cloth to the sinus; and apply the honey, which you have heated until thickened, and sprinkled over a cloth, and press it against the sinus.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	Sometimes, aristolochia longa, roots of the lily of the valley (and it is the lily of the valley), and the flour of eryngo and centaury are administered with it.  Grind and sift these herbs into powder over the honey, as previously mentioned; and use that.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sinus is prolonged and not cured by this treatment, then know that the corruption is in the bone beneath it, or in other hard members or ligaments.  Then treat it with fistulous treatment, as was described above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Of the treatment of felon (panaricium), and of the injured or damaged nail, and of the incision of the afflicted finger, and of the section.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	A felon (panaricium) is an abscess that arises beneath the nail of the finger of the hand or foot, and it often arises on other fingers.  When it is prolonged and its treatment is less successful, or is an abscess of a severe abscess, or is corrupt, and it sheds matter until it rots the roots of the nail, and often corrupts the entire nail, and often spreads its corruption to the bone until it produces a foul odor, and the end of the finger becomes discolored and dark.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And therefore, when you have done as we have said in the division and your treatment does not succeed, then you must cut away all the excess matter that remains from the nail with a knife, and then cauterize the wound with it, for cautery is very helpful in this.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	However, if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and the nail bed has already begun to compress the flesh in the affected area, and begins to pierce and irritate the area, then you should place a fine blade under the nail's edge where it is piercing the flesh, and lift that flesh and cut it easily.  Apply burning and corrosive medicines to what remains of the flesh until it is all removed; and then treat it with ointments until it is healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if the corruption has already reached the bone, then you must cut into the bone and remove it, for a bone that is corrupted will never heal.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the corruption and decay spread to the finger, then you should cut into it at one of its joints, according to how its recovery is expected, and then treat it until healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if the nail has suffered a blow or abrasion, and there is intense pain, then you should initially perform bloodletting on the patient, and then carefully cut the nail with a sharp blade in a transverse cut from top to bottom, being careful not to cut into the flesh beneath the nail, for you will cause the patient intense pain, and cause a buildup of excess flesh in that area.  Then treat that area with whatever remedies alleviate pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	But a swollen finger, which is often found in some men's hands, is easily swollen in the flesh, and easily swollen in the bone, or easily swollen in the nail.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of these swellings are born at the joint, or their origin is in certain joints of the fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	But the one that is born in certain joints of the finger is not harmful, and the one that is born in the joints is easily inflamed.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And for those that are fleshy swellings, the incision is gentle, and you should cut it away from its base with a broad blade.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	But for the one that is born at the base of the joint, the cure is difficult; therefore, be careful of severing it.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But for the one that is born on the finger near the joints, you should initially cut the flesh around it in a circular incision to the bone, and then trim it with one of the suitable saws for this, and then treat it until it heals.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	However, if the fingers become fused together – either naturally or due to a birth defect, a plague, a burn, or similar causes – then it is necessary to sever that fusion until the fingers return to their natural shape.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And then place between them strips of cloth soaked in heated oil, so that they do not fuse together prematurely, and separate them, or place a thin sheet of lead between them until they are healed properly.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly, if a fusion occurs between a finger and the palm, then sever that fusion as the preparation and shape of the limb requires.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Of incisions of veins, they are varicose veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Veins are varicose veins, and are thick veins filled with melancholic excess fluids that accumulate in various parts of the body, and predominantly in the legs, especially in the legs of travelers, laborers, and those who carry heavy loads.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Therefore, you should administer purgation of the body of black bile several times with strong expulsion, and then bleed the patient from the basilica vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	However, their treatment with iron is in two ways: one is that the veins are incised and that black blood is drawn out, and the other way is that the vein is raised and the whole thing extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The section of it is done in this manner: First, soak the leg in very hot water until the thick, feculent blood in the leg is dissolved, then tightly bind the patient's leg from the highest part of the thigh down to the groin with a bandage.  Then cut the vein at one, two, or three places with a wide incision.  Next, raise the black blood with your hand from the bottom of the leg upward, and downward to upward, until the desired amount of blood has been drawn and the patient's condition is relieved.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then bandage it, and instruct him to abstain from foods that generate black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And repeat the treatment by phlebotomy when the veins are filled and this benefits the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	But their elevation is performed in this manner: you are to lift the patient's leg, if it is very swollen, and then immerse it in a bath and soak the leg in hot water until it turns red and the veins are enlarged; or, if a bath is not available, to be exercised vigorously until the limb is warmed.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	Then cut the cord directly over the vein by incision, along the back of the leg below the groin, or at the lowest part of the leg below the ankle.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	Then open the cord with hooks and scrape the vein from all sides until it appears sensitive, and it is at the point where you see the red turning to black.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And then, as you open it, from the cord you see that white which is the string.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	Then place a reed under it so that it is raised and separated from the cord, and suspend it with a hook or forceps.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	Then make another incision near that one, three days later, and then scrape the cord from the part above the vein until it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	Then raise that, and cut it in a second incision towards the heel, and then pull that out and raise it until it comes out through the second incision, and then pull it out of the incision above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	Do this until you extract it from the incision that is highest or most superior of all the incisions, until everything is out; and then cut it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you are unable to extract and elevate it, then insert a needle with a strong double hook and tie it and pull it out, or insert a reed underneath it and move your hand around in all directions until it is thrown out.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	Be careful not to cut it; for if it is broken, it is very difficult for you to elevate it, and it has become a problem for the patient due to that damage.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when you have entirely expelled it, then place on the affected area wool soaked in wine and rubbed oil and un-rubbed oil, and treat it until it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the vein is constricted, having a tortuosity to which it is wrapped in parts, and is not straight as we have said, then it is necessary that you cut along every part of its tortuosity and at the places where it is wrapped, and then suspend it with hooks until you have lifted the whole thing.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And be careful in your incision not to cut the vein and not to damage it, for it will be difficult for you to elevate it; and use your prudence in this.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Form of the incision with which a vein is cut:
Forma de unci orp:	Shape of a surgical hook:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not sharp like hooks, nor has a sharp tip so that it does not damage the vein; and it is of considerable flexibility, like a lion's paw, for if it were thin, it would cut the vein because of its thinness; however, it has a superfluous thickness as we said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Of the extraction of a vein of the leg.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs in hot lands, just like in the lands of the Arabs, and in the hot and arid lands of India, where little vegetation grows, and neither grass nor trees flourish.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is easily generated in other parts of the body besides the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And its generation is from putrefaction arising from beneath the skin, like snakes, worms, and maggots that breed between the skin and flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	And a sign of the onset of this vein is a vehement inflammation in the leg; then the area becomes blistered; and then the vein begins to emerge from the area of that blister, as if it were a plant's root.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And then, when its extremity appears, you should wrap a lead weight around it, which should be the weight of a drachma.  Up to two drachmas, and bind it and leave the lead suspended from the leg.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as many times as any cause of this is outside the parts, wrap that in lead and bind it.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if it is prolonged, then you should incise a part of it and wrap the remainder; and do not incise that part until it has fully emerged, for if you incise it while it is still inside, it will retract into the flesh, causing an abscess and possibly a foul ulceration in that area.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	Therefore, it must be treated gently and extracted little by little, until it is completely expelled from behind it and no part of it remains inside the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein, some men have had it grow to a length of five palms and ten fingers, and it has come to my attention that one has grown to twenty palms in length.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is incised during treatment, then insert the probe into its opening and penetrate it with a long probe, until all that is in the matter is evacuated, and administer treatment for the putrefaction of the area for several days with medicines; then treat it like a festering wound.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes has many branches, especially when it appears at the joint of the foot or on the foot, and has many openings, and a branch emerges from each opening.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	Therefore, treat it in the same way as we have said in the division and with the things previously mentioned.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Of the sectioning of worms generated under the skin, and it is called the bovine disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This illness is called "bovine disease" in some lands near us, because often it affects cattle.  It's a small worm that is born between the skin and flesh, and it travels throughout the body, moving up and down, and its presence is felt as it moves from limb to limb until it breaks through the skin and emerges.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And its generation is due to the putrefaction of certain humors, just as worms, snakes, and other intestinal worms (lombrics and ascarids) are formed within the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared because of its malice, for when it travels through the body and ascends to the head, and reaches the eye, it often causes severe inflammation there and enters, destroying the eye.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.
